Export to File Configuration

When submitting vulnerability data to a CSV file, the configuration file must include a bean definition that configures export-related functionality.

This configuration is defined using the following bean definition in the configuration file:

<bean class="com.fortify.bugtracker.tgt.file.config.FileTargetConfiguration">

This bean definition supports the following properties:

  • groupTemplateExpression: Used for grouping vulnerabilities together into a single output file. The given SpEL template expression will be evaluated to determine the name of the output file.

  • fields: Used for specifying the CSV columns to be exported. This property takes a map, with the column name as the key, and an SpEL template expression as the value for generating the field value.

Following are examples of the bean configuration:

For SSC:

	<bean class="com.fortify.bugtracker.tgt.file.config.FileTargetConfiguration">
		<property name="groupTemplateExpression" value="${#ctx.OutputFile}"/>
		
		<property name="fields"><map>
			<entry key="id" value="${id}"/>
			<entry key="issueInstanceId" value="${issueInstanceId}"/>
			<entry key="issueName" value="${issueName}"/>
			<entry key="fullFileName" value="${fullFileName}"/>
			<entry key="friority" value="${friority}"/>
			<entry key="deepLink" value="${deepLink}"/>
		</map></property>
	</bean

For FoD:

	<bean class="com.fortify.bugtracker.tgt.file.config.FileTargetConfiguration">
		<property name="groupTemplateExpression" value="${#ctx.OutputFile}"/>
		
		<property name="fields"><map>
			<entry key="id" value="${id}"/>
			<entry key="vulnId" value="${vulnId}"/>
			<entry key="category" value="${category}"/>
			<entry key="primaryLocationFull" value="${primaryLocationFull}"/>
			<entry key="severity" value="${severityString}"/>
			<entry key="deepLink" value="${deepLink}"/>
		</map></property>
	</bean
